alert.note: Alert for Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 06 at 1:58PM CDT until August 06 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of west central Illinois, southeast Iowa and northeast Missouri, including the following counties, in west central Illinois, Hancock, Henderson, McDonough and Warren. In southeast Iowa, Des Moines and Lee. In northeast Missouri, Clark and Scotland. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Occasional rounds of showers and thunderstorms are forecast through sunrise Monday. Recent heavy rainfall has led to saturated ground and there is potential for peak rain rates between 1 to 2 inches per hour. Total rainfall will vary across the region, ranging between 1 and 3 inches with isolated higher amounts possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
